pr_title: feat(ExternalIds):Support multi-externalId Values of same externalId key in Project, Component, and Release page

timeline.message:
feat(ExternalIds):Support multi-externalId Values of same externalId key in Project, Component, and Release page

Signed-off-by: He, Albert <albert.he@sap.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Creating an object mapper is a rather expensive operation; so this should not be done for each element in the map. The object creation should at least be moved to the beginning of the method.
As the ObjectMapper class is thread-safe, in this case it would also be an option to have a static ObjectMapper field in PortletUtils that is always reused.
timeline.author: oheger-bosch

replies.bodyText:
Thanks a lot, @oheger-bosch
I have refactored the code.
replies.author: AlbertHjy

replies.bodyText:
@albert-hjy, thanks for the update. This looks better now performance-wise. I am, however, a bit worried that the lazy initialization approach is not thread-safe. As the utils class is called during request execution, there will be multiple threads involved, and we should take care that this is safe.
The easiest solution is certainly to get rid off the lazy initialization, make the ObjectMapper field final, and create the mapper directly.
If you prefer lazy initialization, then I would suggest using the Lazy initialization holder class idiom for static fields.
Please also refer to J. Bloch, "Effective Java", 3rd edition, item 83 "Use lazy initialization judiciously"
replies.author: oheger-bosch

replies.bodyText: @oheger-bosch , thanks a lot. Agree that it's unnecessary to use lazy initialization here. I have changed ObjectMapper field final.
replies.author: AlbertHjy
